snippet: Two top managers of the scandal-plagued Vatican bank resigned on Monday after the arrest of a high-ranking cleric with close ties to the financial institution.
abstract: Paolo Cipriani and Massimo Tulli, top managers of scandal-plagued Vatican bank, resign after arrest of Msgr Nunzio Scarano, high-ranking cleric with close ties to the financial institution who is accused of plotting to smuggle $26 million into Italy from Switzerland.
lead_paragraph: Two top managers of the scandal-plagued Vatican bank resigned on Monday after the arrest of a high-ranking cleric with close ties to the financial institution.

headline.main: Italy: 2 Top Managers at Vatican Bank Step Down
headline.print_headline: Italy: 2 Top Managers at Vatican Bank Step Down
